title: Hertz Orders 100,000 Teslas, Part of Plan to Electrify Fleet
sub_head: Car-rental firm, recently emerged from bankruptcy under new ownership, orders vehicles by the end of 2022
body:
Hertz Global Holdings Inc. said it has ordered 100,000 Tesla Inc. vehicles by the end of 2022, a move aimed at including more electric vehicles in its car-rental fleet.
The Estero, Fla., company said that starting in early November and expanding through the end of the year, Hertz customers will be able to rent a Tesla Model 3 at airports and other locations in major U.S. markets and some cities in Europe.
